verses.devanagari:
ओं केनेषितं पतति प्रेषितं मनः केन प्राणः प्रथमः प्रैति युक्तः ।
केनेषितां वाचमिमां वदन्ति चक्षुः श्रोत्रं क उ देवो युनक्ति ॥ १ ॥
verses.iast:
oṃ keneṣitaṃ patati preṣitaṃ manaḥ kena prāṇaḥ prathamaḥ praiti yuktaḥ |
keneṣitāṃ vācam imāṃ vadanti cakṣuḥ śrotraṃ ka u devo yunakti || 1 ||
verses.translation: By whose will is the mind directed? By whose command does the foremost life-breath move? By whose impulse do people speak this speech? Which deity harnesses the eye and ear?

verses.devanagari:
श्रोत्रस्य श्रोत्रं मनसो मनो यद्वाचो ह वाचं स उ प्राणस्य प्राणश्चक्षुषश्चक्षुः ।
अतिमुच्य धीराः प्रेत्यास्माल्लोकादमृता भवन्ति ॥ २ ॥
verses.iast:
śrotrasya śrotraṃ manaso mano yadvāco ha vācaṃ sa u prāṇasya prāṇaścakṣuṣaścakṣuḥ |
atimucya dhīrāḥ pretyāsmāllokādamṛtā bhavanti || 2 ||
verses.translation: It is the ear of the ear, the mind of the mind, the speech of speech, the breath of breath, and the eye of the eye. The wise, having loosened (this identification), departing from this world, become immortal.

verses.devanagari:
न तत्र चक्षुर्गच्छति न वाग्गच्छति नो मनो न विद्मो न विजानीमो यथैतदनुशिष्यादन्यदेव तद्विदितादथो अविदितादधि |
इति शुश्रुम पूर्वेषां ये नस्तद्व्याचचक्षिरे ॥ ३ ॥
verses.iast:
na tatra cakṣurgacchati na vāggacchati no mano na vidmo na vijānīmo yathaitadanuśiṣyād anyad eva tad viditād atho aviditād adhi |
iti śuśruma pūrveṣāṃ ye nas tad vyācacakṣire || 3 ||
verses.translation: There the eye does not go, nor speech, nor mind. We do not know; we do not understand how one could teach it. It is truly other than the known and beyond the unknown—so we have heard from the ancients who expounded it to us.

verses.devanagari:
यद्वाचानभ्युदितं येन वागभ्युद्यते ।
तदेव ब्रह्म त्वं विद्धि नेदं यदिदमुपासते ॥ ४ ॥
verses.iast:
yad vācānabhyuditaṃ yena vāg abhyudyate |
tad eva brahma tvaṃ viddhi nedaṃ yad idam upāsate || 4 ||
verses.translation: That which speech does not reveal, but by which speech is revealed—know that alone to be Brahman, not this which people here worship.

verses.devanagari:
यन्मनसा न मनुते येनाहुर्मनो मतम् ।
तदेव ब्रह्म त्वं विद्धि नेदं यदिदमुपासते ॥ ५ ॥
verses.iast:
yan manasā na manute yenāhur mano matam |
tad eva brahma tvaṃ viddhi nedaṃ yad idam upāsate || 5 ||
verses.translation: What the mind cannot think, but by which they say the mind thinks—know that alone to be Brahman, not this which people here worship.

verses.devanagari:
यच्चक्षुषा न पश्यति येन चक्षूँषि पश्यति ।
तदेव ब्रह्म त्वं विद्धि नेदं यदिदमुपासते ॥ ६ ॥
verses.iast:
yac cakṣuṣā na paśyati yena cakṣūm̐ṣi paśyati |
tad eva brahma tvaṃ viddhi nedaṃ yad idam upāsate || 6 ||
verses.translation: What is not seen by the eye, but by which the eyes see—know that alone to be Brahman, not this which people here worship.

verses.devanagari:
यच्छ्रोत्रेण न शृणोति येन श्रोत्रमिँश्रुतम् ।
तदेव ब्रह्म त्वं विद्धि नेदं यदिदमुपासते ॥ ७ ॥
verses.iast:
yac chrotreṇa na śṛṇoti yena śrotram im̐ śrutam |
tad eva brahma tvaṃ viddhi nedaṃ yad idam upāsate || 7 ||
verses.translation: What is not heard with the ear, but by which the ear hears—know that alone to be Brahman, not this which people here worship.

verses.devanagari:
यत्प्राणेन न प्राणिति येन प्राणः प्रणीयते ।
तदेव ब्रह्म त्वं विद्धि नेदं यदिदमुपासते ॥ ८ ॥
verses.iast:
yat prāṇena na prāṇiti yena prāṇaḥ praṇīyate |
tad eva brahma tvaṃ viddhi nedaṃ yad idam upāsate || 8 ||
verses.translation: What none breathes with the breath, but by which breath is impelled—know that alone to be Brahman, not this which people here worship.
